cells.data:
Permutations and Combinations

Order matters for a permutation: A permutation $p$ of a set $S$ is an ordered arrangement of elements of $S$
An $r$-permutation has magnitude $|p| = r$

$P(n,r)$ is number of $r$-permutations of a set with $n$ elements
$P(n,r) = \frac{n!}{(n-r)!}$

Note that the empty or identity product ($0!$) is $1$, and the empty sum is $\sum_{x \in \emptyset} x = 0$

Order does not distinguish one combination from another: A combination $c$ of a set $S$ is an non-ordered subset of elements of $S$
An $r$-combination has magnitude $|c| = r$

$C(n,r)$ is number of $r$-combinations of a set with $n$ elements
$C(n,r) = \frac{n!}{(n-r)! \cdot r!} = \frac{P(n,r)}{r!}$
Also called $n$ choose $r$, $_nC_r$, $\left(\begin{matrix} n \\ r \end{matrix}\right)$

$C(n,r) = C(n,n-r)$
